block_list.title: Video Tutorial
block_list.body: This is Paper Plane 33 of our 100 Exotic Paper Airplane Challenge. It is the "Flying Fish" designed by Stephen Weiss. This origami airplane leans more towards the difficult side but it is worth it. This origami plane flies really well for it's form and size. I would say this origami plane is more like a dart than a glider. It is folded from a single square sheet. Enjoy!!! If you missed my last Exotic Paper Airplane "Paper Plane 32 : Windblown by Didier Boursin", you could watch it at https://youtu.be/eXFBMOt-c3s Flying Fish by Stephen Weiss Tutorial Timeline: 0:00 Demonstration 0:10 Flight Test 0:42 Pre-crease the Paper 1:24 Folding the Leading Edge 2:17 Folding the Aircraft's Fuselage 3:33 Folding the Aircraft's Nose 4:13 Folding the Aircraft's Tail 5:14 Folding the Vertical Stabilizer 5:56 Folding the Wings 6:15 Open the Aircraft 6:29 Paper Airplane Grip Thanks For Watching! Wilson Lee @Heap Art
